name: Vincci Palace Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in vinci palace in february and may this year. The first visit was on business, we loved the city so much we decided to take a week's vacation there and explore further. We absolutely loved the city and the people. And our stay at vinci was excellent. This hotel provides great value for money. Yes, the rooms are small but when you visit valencia you're really not in your room for long. The breakfast was excellent with a very wide choice of food, the fresh fruit was the best I've tasted in a hotel. The service was excellent. All members on the front desk were very helpful. All in all we enjoyed our vacation to the full. There is nothing that was too much trouble from any of the staff. Hopefully we will be back again next year and our choice is definitely vinci palace.
reviews.title: Super hotel close to the old city centre
Perfect!
reviews.text: Perfect location - right next to a tube which comes in straight from the airport, and bang in the middle of the city, but not noisy. Amazing rooms for the ridiculously affordable price. Service was so nice we felt obliged enough to leave a thank you gift for them (not something I normally do). Very good breakfast as well. The decor is in great condition and outside facade is beautiful. Only downside- no spa facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well located, just a block away from Plaza dela Reina and a few meters from El corte ingles and subway station. You can visit almost everything by walking. The room really cozy with an enclosed balcony, the only problem was the shower that wet all over the floor, but not a big deal after all. I specially enjoyed the "pillow menu", where you can choose the kind of pillow you pretend from a variety they offer. The staff was helpfull and very kind. Breakfast was self service with a good variety of food.
reviews.title: Top!

reviews.text: The hotel is about 7 minutes walk from the cathedral and old town; nice room and bathroom, interesting lightning system. Very close (3minutes walk) from the shopping area (a huge Il corte ingles store and some pedestrian full of shops streets). Very close to the bus stop from where you can go to the beach or to the City of Arts and Sciences.
reviews.title: Nice, central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice staff, always with a smile on their faces!
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at this hotel, the location is perfect - closed to the old city within minutes from the Cathedral & plenty of bars / restaurants near by. The breakfast buffet has plenty of choice but there's a Starbuck next door or a local cafe, so plenty to choose from. The room we had is first floor inner courtyard room (cheapest option), although it does not have any views but very quiet & we even can keep the window open at night as the A/C could be a bit too freezing.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: The only shame is the sun deck at the top is too small & can only hold two people & always seems to be fully occupied. But then the beach is just a train ride away & the nearest station (Colon) is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. There's a giant Department store neat the hotel, so even when the local shops were closed, we can just pop round as it open until 8pm.
reviews.title: Excellent location. Great base..
Modern "boutique" feel hotel in a great location
reviews.text: Overall, the experience is pleasant and relaxing. Valencia is a beautiful city & all within walking distance from the hotel. Definately will recommend this place, hope to be back again soon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good hotel. Well situated in the old town. Near to the metro, restaurants and the old sites. Clean rooms. A lovely boutique hotel. Quiet. Air con in rooms good. Could have been a little cooler in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Great place and not expensive
Good location, friendly staff, fair price
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in August. Hotel easy to get to from the Colon metro station (direct line from airport). It's in a great location for exploring the city on foot. Clean, modern feel. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast. Decor is fab throughout, including the lavish hallways :) would highly recommend.

We stayed at Vincci Palace for 3 days on business, what a lovely hotel and the staff are so nice and friendly, nothing is any trouble at all. As you walk into the hotel you will be welcomed not only by the friendly staff but the fine reception area. Rooms are not over generous but have everything you need and the beds are comfy. Breakfast was plentiful with fresh fruits, breads, hams, cheese, yogurts, cereals and hot food there too if required. I loved this hotel and would be very very happy to go back. It was recommended to us by our Spanish partners along with a number of others, I think we chose the best. The location was great, if you come out and turn right and walk to the bottom of the street you come to a park with the most amazing trees, I sat there for the 10 spare minutes I had and enjoyed the silence. If you turn left out of the hotel and walk for about 7/8 minutes you will come to the square. With bars and the cathedral, Valencia what fantastic place has to be one of the nicest cities there is.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed for one night but looking back wish we had stayed here for our entire stay. We arrived for our 4 night stay at the Vincci Lys ( Sister hotel ) only to be told they had problems with their booking system. So we were informed that a room at been arranged at the Vincci Palace and in the morning we would be able to return.
reviews.title: Clean, Good service and perfect base for holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving in the plush lobby we were greeted with very friendly receptionists who knew all about our arrival beforehand. Once we got into the room we were pleasantly surprised with the layout. Even though the rooms are not massive which is typical of city hotels they include free wifi which is always a bonus. Especially loved the bathroom with the stylish shower and different types of pressure. The receptionists were extremely helpful with hints and maps and really close to all monuments. A perfect base to have as your holiday and only regret is we didn’t stay the whole 4 nights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night break at the Vincci Palace. Ideally located approximately 5 - 8 mins walk from the Colon metro stop you can get from the airport to the hotel in around 40 minutes - ideal for a city break. Reception staff were extremely friendly and, importantly, spoke great english - which compensated for my very poor command of spanish. Room 305 was extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean and a good size. We also had breakfast as part of our room rate - which was ideal and provided a stress free start to the day. Buffet style, the food was tasty and provided a good choice. The Vincci Palace is in an ideal location for access to the centre (Plaza de la Reina) and the park in the dry river bed. We chose to take the city tour bus on the 2nd day (24 hour ticket 16 Euros each) which allowed us to hop off and hop on as well as change routes between the historic city and the beach tours. This was ideal. For dining - there are many restaurants close to the hotel and, overall, we found the prices to be extremely reasonable. You could get a perfectly acceptable 3 course meal in the Plaza de la Reina for 16 Euros. Valencia is a great place to just walk around with the occasional stop for a glass of wine or beer. The city is clean and vibrant and, like Barcelona, incorporates a city and beach combination. A must!
reviews.title: Stopped for 8 nights and found it very comfortable

reviews.text: The hotel is a fantastic location, near the old town, main shopping area just round the corner. The staff were lovely, very helpful, made recommendations and reservations etc.
reviews.title: Very nice, comfortable hotel in a great location
Good quality and value in central location
reviews.text: We have stayed here a couple of times before and have always found it a reliable and convenient choice. This one was no different. We know the city very well and it is a good location - close to the old part of town but quieter. Although on a reasonably busy road the rooms on the road side are well sound proofed. We had a small balcony and a smart clean room for about €75 which I think is reasonable for a city centre 4*. The staff seem friendly, efficient and speak various languages. My only complaint would be lack of free wi-fi. I haven't tried the food as it is easy to get a good breakfast locally rather than go for an over-priced buffet.

The hotel is only 200 mt to historical area.it s clean and chic hotel,breakfast was on the average,it has full of croissants. There was a one big problem about towels!all towels was smelling as a bacon and pig! If you dry yourself with towels,you feel dirty, despite take a shower.The hotel should change it system or the towels.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: We and two friends spent two nights at this hotel last weekend on a special deal via Secret Escapes, which included breakfast. When we arrived at the hotel at c.3pm, we were informed that the rooms were not ready, no apology whatsoever,however we were able to leave our bags at reception. There is a car park under the hotel, which is accessed by a car lift. If you are going to park here, ensure you have nothing bigger than a Fiesta type car, as it is VERY tight! The rooms were finally available at c.4pm and were on the 4th floor. Rooms 410 & 411 had been converted from a suite and the air con for both rooms were controlled from room 410! The rooms were spacious, clean and had a great bathroom with excellent water pressure. If you are staying at this hotel with friends I would suggest you request these two rooms, as they have a small "lounge area" and a "private" terrace, which makes them excellent. The breakfast was good too and the whole hotel had a good feel to it. The reception staff, other than when we tried to check-in, were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. As mentioned in previous reviews it is in a great city centre location, close to the station, bullring, cathedral, shops etc etc. The only real negative was the smell of bad drains in the hallways. I appreciate that there is often drain smells in European cities, but this was really rather unpleasant. Luckily the rooms didn't smell though. All in all, a good hotel, in a fantastic location, but you might have to put up with having to wait for your rooms and drain smells!
reviews.title: Great rooms, but the smell ....

reviews.text: Myself and 7 friends have just come back from spending a fantastic weekend in Valencia. The hotel was very central and about 5-7 mins walk away from Colon metro station. We took the metro from the airport and it took around 25/30 mins. Our rooms were ready when we arrived and we had two rooms on the fourth floor and two on the fifth floor. The only bad comment was that there was a very bad smell of drains on the fifth floor rooms but the fourth floor rooms were fine. The rooms were a decent size and had a a lovely sized bathroom. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Weekend away with the girls

reviews.text: 5 mins from the hotel you were near the cathedral and squares with lots of eating places and also near the large food market which is a must.
reviews.title: Superlative service

description: In the most select district in the centre of the Turia’s capital, we find the Vincci Palace Valencia.﻿ Located on calle de La Paz, two steps away from the Plaza Porta de la Mar and Paseo de la Ciudadela, it is in the city’s great tourist area, five minutes away from the Cathedral and the Church of Nuestra Señora de los Desamparados (Our Lady of the Forsaken), also right next door to the Serranos towers and the famous “Miguelete”. The building, in the traditional style of most palace residences in the city centre, has been totally refurbished to maintain its impressive façade while remodelling its interior to make it one of the capital’s most contemporary hotel establishments.
